Articles.Content: i have a little problem. I dont understand how to install this. I am a noob when it comes to computers and i was wondering if anyone has an installation video/tutorial.

What version of KSP are you using? If the current one, you should be using Mission Controller Extended.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/43645-%280-21%29-Mission-Controller-Extended-%28Version-17%29-%28FORK%29-%28ALPHA%29

Extract the archive into the GameData folder in your KSP install folder.
I can't select a mission, when I click a mission package, the window closes?

I can't select a mission, when I click a mission package, the window closes?

Go here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/43645-%280-21%29-Mission-Controller-Extended-%28Version-18-1%29-%28FORK%29-%28ALPHA%29

Get that instead. If Im not mistaken, you should just be able to write it over your current install, and keep your save data, not sure though.

i have a little problem. I dont understand how to install this. I am a noob when it comes to computers and i was wondering if anyone has an installation video/tutorial.

I can help you, if installed with steam, open my computer go to your hard drive, (Ususally C:/) now go to program files (x86) if that isnt there then go to program files now once you are there if installed with steam go to steam steamapps common kerbalspaceprogram gamedata and drag the "MissionController" folder into gamedata. if not purchased via steam, it should be Kerbal Space Program just sitting in one of your program files folders. if this is still confusing, and you DO HAVE the STEAM version, you can go into libraries, right click ksp, properties, local files on top, and browse local files. then open up gamedata and drag MissionController in, i hope i had helped!
Hi "nobody44", and whoever knows how to solve my problem, the mission controller window is empty and shows no mission packages to choose from.. help?
